meanings.definition: A machine used for cutting square or rectangular holes in wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used the mortiser to create precise holes in the wooden plank.
meanings.sent2: The mortiser is an essential tool in woodworking for making clean cuts.
meanings.sent3: When the mortiser broke down, the carpenter had to resort to old-fashioned hand tools.
meanings.sent4: The mortiser worked tirelessly, churning out perfectly shaped holes in the wood.
meanings.sent5: The loud whirring of the mortiser echoed through the workshop as it carved out the holes.

meanings.sent1: The skilled mortiser carefully chiseled out the intricate designs on the wooden door.
meanings.sent2: The mortiser's expertise in creating precise joints was unmatched in the carpentry shop.
meanings.sent3: The mortiser jokingly referred to themselves as the 'hole master' among their colleagues.
meanings.sent4: In the world of woodworking, the mortiser was the unsung hero behind every sturdy structure.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand and keen eye, the mortiser transformed plain wood into works of art.
